laboratory_examinations.findings: Isolate of Salmonella enterica serotype typhimurium, found to be resistant to ampicillin, chloramphenicol, tetracycline, sulfisoxazole, kanamycin, and streptomycin as well as to both broad-spectrum and expanded-spectrum cephalosporins including ceftriaxone and ceftiofur.

The isolate from the child and one cattle isolate both had resistance to ceftriaxone with a minimal inhibitory concentration of greater than 64 µg/mL and to ceftiofur with a minimal inhibitory concentration of greater than 16 µg/mL. The other three cattle isolates were resistant to ampicillin, tetracycline, kanamycin, streptomycin, and sulfisoxazole, but not to ceftriaxone or ceftiofur.

The isolate from the child was nearly indistinguishable from the cattle isolate 1, with similar restriction-fragment patterns, including a unique band (band I) indicative of ceftriaxone resistance, present only in ceftriaxone-resistant isolates.
